title: Strictly Come Dancing’s Anneka Rice nearly has second phone mishap with Kevin Clifton
text:
Poor Kevin…(Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing star Anneka Rice had yet another ‘phone’ mishap with Kevin Clifton after apologising for accidentally putting her hand in his lap.

The TV star previously mistook Kevin’s phone for something else entirely during a previous TV appearance together, and history nearly repeated itself on spin off show It Takes Two.

On Tuesday’s show Anneka told host Rylan Clark-Neal about how Strictly had encouraged her to become more feminine.

She explained: ‘I turned up as a tomboy and now, I’ve just been out shopping with my son Sam who’s here and I went and I’ve just bought three dresses.’

‘It’s a transformation’, Kevin added.

As she started her next sentence, Anneka apologised to Kevin as she thought she had touched him somewhere inappropriate.

Anneka began: ‘I’m just not interested in…sorry….’

The pair nearly had another ‘phone’ mishap (Picture: BBC)

The pair crashed out of Strictly during Movie Week (Picture: BBC)

Kevin looked down at his lap confused as the ex Strictly star laughed.

Advertisement

Advertisement

As the rest of the studio joined in, Rylan issued a jokey warning.

He said: ‘Not again, not again. I saw you on This Morning, thank you.

‘It’s his phone don’t worry. Move on swiftly Anneka!’

A similar thing happened with the pair on This Morning as Anneka inspected Kevin’s leg and asked: ‘What’s that?’

As the dancer quickly explained she was touching his phone, presenter Phillip Schofield joked: ‘It’s the Strictly curse already, one week, one week!’

The Challenge Anneka star was booted off the show during Movie Week last Saturday as their Kill Bill inspired routine failed to impress.

She admitted that she didn’t have a say in the routine, and would have preferred something more graceful like their waltz the week before.

‘I wish I’d done more of that kind of dancing. The producers kept getting me to run around,’ Anneka explained.

Full of praise for Kevin, she went on: ‘I’m a transformed person. He is the most patient brilliant man who I’ve met in a very long time.’

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.
